section.p: 1. The six per cent who read poetry may also be included in the 48 per cent for fiction or the 44 per cent for non-fiction, but we don't know for sure.
2. Look at the percentage for the 'Poetry' column in the bar chart.
3. The pie chart refers to those who read poetry and shows what gender they are.
4. Of all the adults who read poetry, 26 per cent are men.
5. 55 per cent of people who read fiction are women, which is roughly two-thirds.
6. Only 48 per cent of adults read fiction.
7. The percentage of the population who read fiction is higher than that for any other kind of literature.
8. Only 48 per cent of adults read fiction.
9. The chart does not give figures for the whole population, only for adults.
10. The pie chart for non-fiction tells us that over half of all readers of non-fiction are women.
11. The 45 per cent in the pie chart for non-fiction refers to readers of non-fiction. It doesn't mean 45 per cent of all New Zealand men.
12. We don't have enough information to say that this statement is true or false.
